newsitem.title: JAPAN: Short-term profit hunting lifts Shinko Elec shares.
newsitem.headline: Short-term profit hunting lifts Shinko Elec shares.

text.p: Shares in Shinko Electric Co Ltd were higher in quiet, early afternoon Monday trade, lifted by investors out for short-term profits, brokers said.
As of 0430 GMT the shares, the most heavily traded issue in the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange with a volume of 3.799 million shares, were 10 yen higher at 598 yen.
Brokers said the expiry date for six-month margin transactions logged in April had passed, making it easier for investors to trade the shares.

They added that although Japan's general elections were over, the market has retreated into a wait-and-see mood and that investors have no choice but to shuffle incentive-backed shares around to obtain profits.
